summary: This is an FBI intake document dated July 9, 2020, recording a social media tip received on July 6, 2020. The tip, from a Twitter user, alleges that Ghislaine Maxwell was involved in providing underage females for sex to celebrities. The document outlines the FBI's process for monitoring social media for potential threats.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the case title for child sex trafficking. The document is part of the investigation into his activities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: A Twitter user alleges she was involved in providing underage females for sex to celebrities, which prompted this FBI intake.

connections.description: The social media tip alleges Maxwell's involvement in providing underage females, which is central to the Epstein child sex trafficking investigation.

events.title: Social Media Tip Received
events.description: The FBI Office of Public Affairs forwarded a comment from Twitter user @justagook alleging Ghislaine Maxwell's involvement in providing underage females for sex to celebrities.

events.title: FBI Intake Document Created
events.description: An FBI intake document (Case ID 50D-NY-3027571) was drafted, formally recording the social media tip for assessment and potential investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI's Office of Public Affairs monitors social media comments for keywords that may indicate threats, automatically generating tips for assessment.
A Twitter user (@justagook) alleged that Ghislaine Maxwell was involved in providing underage females for sex to celebrities, prompting this FBI intake.
The document shows the FBI's procedural response to public tips related to the ongoing Jeffrey Epstein child sex trafficking investigation.
The tip was processed by the National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) for a credibility assessment.
